intro: Centropogon milleanus, commonly known as the Mexican firecracker. It is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America, belonging to the Acanthaceae family. The plant is characterized by its striking red and orange tubular flowers, which are adapted for pollination by hummingbirds. It typically grows in sunny, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions. Centropogon milleanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and showy blooms.
